00037 #define KVI_MIRCCOLOR_MAX_FOREGROUND 15
00038 #define KVI_MIRCCOLOR_MAX_BACKGROUND 15
00039 
00040 
00041 
00042 // ASCII Stuff: the following defines are meant to be escape sequences
00043 //              that can go thru an IRC connection
00044 
00045 // The following table is a 30-minute analysis of the escape characters commonly used over the IRC protocol...
00046 // created when looking for a good placement for the CRYPT escape char in KVirc.
00047 // I guess that the best chars to be used were FS,GS,RS,US,DC1,DC2,DC3,DC4...they have the "less defined"
00048 // meaning as ASCII control chars.
00049 // mmmh... :) 
00050 
00051 // ASCII                              IRC Meaning
00052 // 000 NUL Null                       (Cannot be assigned)
00053 // 001 SOH Start of heading           ( CTCP Escape: only beginning of the message )
00054 // 002 STX Start of text              ( Bold text )
00055 // 003 ETX End of text                ( Color text escape sequence )
00056 // 004 EOT End of transmission        ( Assigned internally (escape) )
00057 // 005 ENQ Enquiry (WRU: Who are you) ( Assigned internally (unescape) )
00058 // 006 ACK Acknowledge                (Not so good, but can be used as last resource)
00059 // 007 BEL Bell                       ( Recognized as bell by terminals and IRCII ) (Used also by some IRC servers)
00060 // 008 BS  Backspace                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00061 // 009 HT  Horizontal tabulation      (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00062 // 010 LF  Line feed                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00063 // 011 VT  Vertical tabulation        (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00064 // 012 FF  Form feed                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00065 // 013 CR  Carriage return            (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00066 // 014 SO  Shift out                  (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00067 // 015 SI  Shift in                   ( Resets Bold,Color,Underline and Reverse ) (Conflicting with terminal control)
00068 // 016 DLE Data link escape           (Decent, can be assigned)
00069 // 017 DC1 Device control 1           (Good to be assigned)
00070 // 018 DC2 Device control 2           (Good to be assigned)
00071 // 019 DC3 Device control 3           (Good to be assigned)
00072 // 020 DC4 Device control 4           (Good to be assigned)
00073 // 021 NAK Negative acknowledge       (Not so good, but could be used as last resource)
00074 // 022 SYN Synchronous idle           ( Reverse text )
00075 // 023 ETB End of transmission block  (Decent, can be assigned)
00076 // 024 CAN Cancel                     (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00077 // 025 EM  End of medium              (Decent, can be assigned)
00078 // 026 SUB Substitute                 (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00079 // 027 ESC Escape                     (Should not be assigned: terminal control)
00080 // 028 FS  File separator             (Excellent, should be used as first candidate)
00081 // 029 GS  Group separator            ( ICONS Escape: beginning of a word )
00082 // 030 RS  Record separator           ( CRYPT Escape: only beginning of the message )
00083 // 031 US  Unit separator             ( Underline text )
00084 
00085 
00086 //
00087 // mIrc control codes
00088 //
00089 //31 (0001 1111) US (Unit separator)
00090 //2  (0000 0010) STX (Start of text)
00091 //15 (0000 1111) SI (Shift in)
00092 //22 (0001 0110) SYN (Synchronous idle)
00093 //3  (0000 0011) ETX (End of text)
00094 
00095 //
00096 // Irc control codes
00097 //
00098 //1 (0000 0001) SOH (Start of heading)
00099 
00100 //
00101 // KVirc added control codes
00102 //
00103 //30 (0001 1110) RS (Record separator)
00104 //29 (0001 1101) GS (Group separator)
00105 
00106 
00107 #ifndef _KVI_MIRCCNTRL_CPP_
00108         extern KVILIB_API const char * getColorBytes(const char *data_ptr,unsigned char *byte_1,unsigned char *byte_2);
00109         extern KVILIB_API const kvi_wchar_t * getColorBytesW(const kvi_wchar_t *data_ptr,unsigned char *byte_1,unsigned char *byte_2);
00110         extern KVILIB_API unsigned int getUnicodeColorBytes(const QString &szData,unsigned int charIdx,unsigned char *byte_1,unsigned char *byte_2);
00111         inline const QChar * getUnicodeColorBytes(const QChar *pData,unsigned char *byte_1,unsigned char *byte_2)
00112                 { return (QChar *)getColorBytesW((const kvi_wchar_t *)pData,byte_1,byte_2); }
00113 #endif

00116 {
00121         enum Color {
00122                 White       =   0,   
00123                 Black       =   1,   
00124                 DarkBlue    =   2,   
00125                 DarkGreen   =   3,   
00126                 Red         =   4,   
00127                 DarkRed     =   5,   
00128                 DarkViolet  =   6,   
00129                 Orange      =   7,   
00130                 Yellow      =   8,   
00131                 LightGreen  =   9,   
00132                 BlueMarine  =  10,   
00133                 LightBlue   =  11,   
00134                 Blue        =  12,   
00135                 LightViolet =  13,   
00136                 DarkGray    =  14,   
00137                 LightGray   =  15,   
00138                 Transparent = 100,   
00139                 NoChange    = 101    
00140         };
00141 
00146         enum Control {
00147                 CTCP        = 0x01,   
00148                 Bold        = 0x02,   
00149                 Color       = 0x03,   
00150                 Escape      = 0x04,   
00151                 UnEscape    = 0x05,   
00152                 UnIcon      = 0x06,   
00153                 Reset       = 0x0f,   
00154                 Reverse     = 0x16,   
00155                 Icon        = 0x1d,   
00156                 CryptEscape = 0x1e,   
00157                 Underline   = 0x1f    
00158         };
00159 
00165         KVILIB_API QString stripControlBytes(const QString & szData);
00166 }
